page.title: 03Land Use Around Crail.
page.content: Very fertile,with a southern exposure, the land is good for mixed farming. Wheat and barley still grown,but now mostly vegetables, planted by machinery. One farm uses an artesian well. A helicopter is used for crop spraying. A new crop,oil seed rape,fills the fields with gold. After harvesting it is carried in tanks as it is a wet crop. It is dried at Authermuchty. Some sheep and cattle are fattened but not bred. Seed potatoes are grown, including a specially large variety called Great Britts; Carefully dressed they sell for twice the price. The Latest in farm machinery is used here. A flourishing market garden supplies our fruit and vegetable shop.
